meanings.definition: A group or collection of things or people.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, we saw a sele of colorful birds flying together.
meanings.sent2: The children formed a sele to play a game in the park.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the sele of balloons made the room look festive.
meanings.sent4: The sele of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The sele of flowers in the garden attracted many butterflies.

meanings.definition: To choose or pick out from a larger group.
meanings.sent1: She will sele her favorite toy from the box.
meanings.sent2: Please sele a book from the shelf to read.
meanings.sent3: I will sele the best outfit for the special occasion.
meanings.sent4: He managed to sele the ripest fruit from the tree.
meanings.sent5: It's important to sele the right words when writing a letter.

meanings.definition: To separate or divide into parts.
meanings.sent1: The chef will sele the ingredients before cooking.
meanings.sent2: It's time to sele the tasks among the team members.
meanings.sent3: She tried to sele the puzzle pieces to solve it faster.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will sele the class into groups for the project.
meanings.sent5: He needed to sele the clothes into piles for laundry.
